publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2709 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cancer Research UK-That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of Cancer Research UK as a result of the merger between the Imperial Cancer Research Fund and the Cancer Research Campaign; recognises the unique and essential contribution to cancer research and therapies made by both charities, and, following the creation of Cancer Research UK, welcomes the expansion of specialist trials centres in NHS hospitals.
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Michael Matheson*

S1M-2709 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cancer Research UKâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of Cancer Research UK as a result of the merger between the Imperial Cancer Research Fund and the Cancer Research Campaign; recognises the unique and essential contribution to cancer research and therapies made by both charities, and, following the creation of Cancer Research UK, welcomes the expansion of specialist trials centres in NHS hospitals. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Shona Robison*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Alex Neil*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Mary Scanlon*, Kay Ullrich*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Mr Michael McMahon*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Tricia Marwick*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-2709 Cancer Research UK (lodged on 6 February 2002) Susan Deacon*
